Data indicates that the majority of patients responded between 400mg to 800mg/day. Safety of doses above 800mg/day  has not been evaluated in clinical trials.
doseList.notes: Data indicates that the majority of patients responded between 400mg to 800mg/day. Safety of doses above 800mg/day  has not been evaluated in clinical trials.

doseList.description: Usual dose: Quetiapine should generally be administered with an initial dose of 25mg twice daily, with increments of 25-50mg twice daily or thrice daily on the second and third day, as tolerated, to a target dose range of 300mg to 400mg daily by the 4th day, given twice daily or thrice daily. Further dosage adjustment- if indicated, should generally occur at intervals of not less than 2 days, as steady-state for quetiapine would not be achieved for approximately 1-2 days in the typical patient. When dosage adjustments are necessary, dose increments/decrements of 25-50mg twice daily are recommended.

subDoseList.notes: Further dosage adjustment- if indicated, should generally occur at intervals of not less than 2 days, as steady-state for quetiapine would not be achieved for approximately 1-2 days in the typical patient.

doseList.description: Start with 2mg daily in single or two divided doses; May be increased to 4mg/day on the second day. Most patients benefit from doses of 4-6mg/day, but an optimal response maybe obtained at lower doses. Above 10mg/day may increase extrapyramidal symptoms risk, consider risks vs benefits. Maximum dose 16mg/day.

doseList.description: Titration should begin at 25mg nightly for 1 week. Same patients with refractory forms of epilepsy have tolerated topiramate monotherepy at doses of 1000mg/day.

The recommended starting dose is 10mg once daily with or without food. If there is inadequate weight loss, the dose may be increased after 4 weeks to a total for 15mg once daily. The 5mg dose should be reserved for patients who do ot tolerate 10mg dose. Analysis of numerous variables has indicated that 60% of patients who lose at least 4 lbs in the first 4 weeks of treatment with a given dose of sibutramine in combination with a reduced-calorie diet lose at least 5% of their initial body weight by the end of 6 months to 1 years of treatment on that dose.

doseList.description: A sequential treatment is recommended, initially a daily dose of 75 i.u FSH activity, which is to be continued for at least 7 days; If no ovarian response the daily dose is then gradually increased until follicle growth and/or plasma Estadiol levels indicate an adequate pharmacodynamic response. The daily dose is then maintained until preovulary conditions are fetched when there is  ultrasonographic evidence of a dominant follicle of at least 18 mm in diameter and or when plasma estadial 14 days of treatmet is suffient to reach this state.

Cetrorelix 0.25mg is for subcutaneous Injection into the lower abdominal wall. The content of 1 vial (0.25mg cetrorelix) is to be administered once daily, at 24 hours intervals, either in the morning or in the evening.

Treatment with cetrorelix 0.25mg in the morning should commence on day 5 or 6 of ovarian stimulation (approximately 96 to 120 hours after start of ovarian stimulation)with urinary or recombinant gonadotropins and is to be continued throughout the gonadotropin treatment period including the day of ovulation induction.

Treatment of leprosy started on a low dose (1/4 th of the standard) which then gradually increased so as to take 6 or 8 weeks to reach the standard. The following regimens have been used; 100-200 mg once a day or 200-400mg twice a week or 300-600mg once a week or 1-2 mg/kg/day.

subDoseList.notes: Treatment of leprosy started on a low dose (1/4 th of the standard) which then gradually increased so as to take 6 or 8 weeks to reach the standard.

doseList.description: Adult, initially 50-100mg daily modified according to response.
Treatment- 1 tab. (or 5ml syp.) 5 times daily at 4 hourly intervals omitting the night time dose) for 5 days.
Prophylaxis- 1 tab. Or 5ml 4 times daily at 6 hourly intervals.
Treatment- Under 2 years, ½ tab. Or 2.5ml 5 times daily at 4 hourly intervals for 5 days. Over 2 years, ½ tab. 4 times daily at 6 hourly intervals; over 2 years, same as Adult.
Treatment- Under 2 years, ½ tab. Or 2.5ml 5 times daily at 4 hourly intervals for 5 days. Over 2 years, ½ tab. 4 times daily at 6 hourly intervals; over 2 years, same as Adult.

Monotherapy in Adults- Although a broad range of dosage regiments has been employed, 500 or 600mg/day in two to five divided doses has been commonly used worldwide. Alternatively, a daily dosage of 1000mg in two divided doses has been shown to be effective.

subDoseList.notes: in two to five divided doses
in two divided doses

doseList.description: Monotherapy in Children- In Children over the age of 3 months the recommended starting dosage is 180mg/m^2 body surface area every 6 hours (720mg/m2/day). The maximum dosage should not exceed 200mg every 6 hours. The optimum dosage regimen remains to be determined and may vary from patient to patient. A range of dosage, generally between 120 and 180mg/m2 every 6 hours (between 480 and 720mg/m2/day), has been used.

The recommended dosage of efaviranz is 600mg orally, once daily, in combination with a protease inhibitor and nucleoside analogue reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs). Efavirenz may be taken with or without food; however, a high fat meal may increase the absorption of efavirenz and should be avoided. In order to improve the tolerability of nervous system side effects, bedtime dosing is recommended during the first 2 to 4 weeks of therapy and in patients who continue to experience these symptoms.

doseTime.condition: in order to improve the tolerability of nervous system side effects and in patients who continue to experience these symptoms.

doseList.description: Peadiatric patients: The peadiatric patients include 3 years of age or older and weighing between 10 and 40kg. The recommended dosage of efavirenz is given orally, once daily at a rate- body weight 10 to <15kg,200mg; to <20kg, 250mg; 20 to <25kg, 300mg; 25 to <32.5kg, 350mg; 32.5 to <40kg, 400mg. The recommended dosage for peadiatric patients weighinggreater then 40kg is 600mg (as Adult), once daily.

The recommended dose is 1250mg (250mg x 5 Tablet) twice daily or 750mg (250 x3 Tablet) three times daily. Nefinavir should be taken with a meal. Antiviral activity is enhanced when nelfinavir is administered in combination with nucleoside analogues (e.g lamivudine). Therefore, it is recommended that nelfinavir be used in combination with nucleoside analogues.
Children (2-13 years): The recommended oral dose is 20-30mg/kg per dose, 3 times daily with a meal.
Peadiatric use:The safety, effectiveness and pharmacokinetics of nelfinavir have not been evaluated yet in peadiatric patients below the age of 2 years.

Adult: The recommended oral dose of lamivudine and zidovudine combined preparation is as follows: for Adults and adolescents of age 12 years and above- 1 Tablet (lamivudine 150mg + zidovudine 300mg) twice daily. After successful therapy with low dose nevirapine for two weeks, patients can be switched over to 200mg b.i.d dose provided they have not demonstrated any hypersensitivity reaction (rash, abnormal liver function tests) during their initial exposure.

subDoseList.notes: After successful therapy with low dose nevirapine for two weeks, patients can be switched over to 200mg b.i.d dose provided they have not demonstrated any hypersensitivity reaction (rash, abnormal liver function tests)during their initial exposure to nevirapine.

doseList.description: Treatment of chronic hepatitis-B: The recommended dose of lamivudine is 100mg once a day. The Tablet should be swallowed whole with water and can be adjusted by the physician if there is any renal impairrment. The duration of treatment will be decided by the physician depending on the clinical condition of the patient. If the patient forgets to take the schedule dose in time, take it is soon as remembered & then continue to take it  as instructed.

The recommended duration of treatment: Patients infected with hepatitis C virus (genotype 2 and 3) previously untreated with interferon, should be treated with interferon or peginterferon alfa and ribavirin for 24 weeks. Patients infected with hepatitis C virus (genotype 1 and 4) previously untreated with interferon, should be treated with interferon or peginterferon alfa and ribavirin for 12 to 48 weeks. After 12 weeks to treatment virologic response should be accessed, and if the viral load has been reduced to less than 1% of the load at the start of treatment, the combination should be continued for a total of 48 weeks; But, if the viral load exceeds 1% of the load at the start of treatment, therapy should be discontinued.

The recommended dose of zolmitriptan to teat a migraine attack is 2.5mg. If symptoms persist or return within 24 hours, a second dose has been shown to be effective. If a second dose is required, it should not be taken within 2 hours of the initial dose. If a patient dose not achieve satisfactory relief with 2.5 mg doses, sub sequent attacks can be treated with 5 mg doses of zolmitriptan. In the event of recurrent attacks, it is recommended that the total intake of zolmitriptan in a 24 hour period should not exceed 15 mg. Zolmitriptan is not indicated for prophylaxis of migraine.

doseList.description: Application of a thin layer of pimecrolimus 1% cream to the affected skin twice daily as long as sings and symptoms persist. The cream may be used on all skin areas, including the head and face, neck, and intertriginous areas. In the long-term management of atopic dermatitis (eczema), pimecrolimus 1 % cream treatment should begin at first appearance of signs and symptoms of atopic dermatitis to prevent flares of the disease.

Apply a thin layer of tacrolimus ointment to the affected skin areas twice daily and rub in gently and completely. Treatment should be continued for one week after clearing of signs and symptoms of atopic dermatitis. Tacrolimus ointment should not be used with occlusive dressings, because the safety of tacrolimus use under occlusion, which may promote systemic exposure, has not been evaluated.

Initially 25mg or 30mg daily for about 2 to 4 weeks. Maintenance dose,in general, 25-50mg daily for a further 6 to 8 weeks; may be increased up to a maximum of 75mg daily, If necessary in some cases. The daily dosage is about 0.5mg/kg; higher doses of up to 1mg/kg/day (maximum 35mg/day) may be necessary some cases for limited periods. The maintenance dose should be kept as low as possible in view of possible long-term side effects.

doseList.description: This product should be applied to a well-defined area of vitiligo by the physician and the area is then exposed to a suitable source of UVA or sunlight. Initial exposure time should be conservative and not exceed that which is predicted to be on-half the minimal erythma dojse. Treatment intervals should be regulated by the erythema response; generally once a week is recommended or less often depending on the results. The hand and fingers of the person applying the medication should be protected by gloves of finger cots to avoid photosensitization and possible burns. Pigmentation may begin after a few weeks but significant repigmentation may require 6-9 months of treatment. Periodic re-treatment may be necessary to retain all of the new pigment. Idiopathic vitiligo is reversible but not equally reversible in every patient.

Apply SunBlock 19 or SpectraBanultra 28 carefully and evenly to areas to be exposed or protected only by light clothing. Allow 30 minutes before going out or swimming. A single application may give daylong protection but the product should be re-applied during prolonged period of sunning, swimming or excessive sweaing.

By Injection: The treatment is divided into 2 phases: Correction Phase- 50 IU/kg, 3 times per week by the subcutaneous or intravenous route; when a dose adjustment is necessary, it should be done at 4 week intermals & each adjustment in dose shold be equal to 25 IU/kg. Maintenance Phase- The usual dose is between 30 and 100 IU/kg, 3 times per week; the maximum dosage should not exceed 200 IU/kg, 3 times per week. By the subcutaneous route, the mean dose is 20-30% lower than the intravenous dose. If the haemoglobin exceeds 13gm/dl, the dose should be discontinued until the haemoglobin drops to 12gm/dl. The dose should be reduced by 25% when treatment is resumed and then titrated to maintain haemoglobin level. When the treatment is stopped, the haemoglobin concentration falls by around 0.5gm/dl per week.

subDoseList.notes: when a dose adjustment is necessary, it should be done at 4 week intermals & each adjustment in dose shold be equal to 25 IU/kg.
the maximum dosage should not exceed 200 IU/kg, 3 times per week.

doseList.indication: Treatment of anaemia of chronic renal failure
doseList.description: Treatment of anaemia of chronic renal failure: The recormon pre-filled syringe is ready for use. The solution can be administ-ered subcutaneously or intravenously in case of intravenous administration, the solution should be injected over approximately 2 minutes e.g in haemodailysis patients via the arteriovenous fintula at the end of dailysis. For non-haemodailysed patients s.c administration should always be preferred in order to avoid puncture of peripheral veins. The aim of treatment is to increase the packed cell volume to 30 to 35% whereby the weekly increase should be at least 0.5% a Value of 35% should not be exceeded. In the presence of Hypertension or existing cardiovascular, cerebrovas-cular or peripheral vascular diseases, the weekly increase in the PCV and the target PCV should be determined individually taking into account the clinical picture. In some patients the optimum PCV may be below 30%.

To prepare a 250ml feeding, put 200ml of cold water in a glass. Gradually add 6 level scoops (enclosed) of powder while stirring and mix until dissolved. When mixed as directed powder provides approx. 1 kcal per ml.
To prepare a 240ml feeding, put 200ml of cold water in a glass. Gradually add 5 level scoops (enclosed) or 45.4gm of powder while stirring and mix until dissolved.

To prepare a 225ml feeding, put 190ml of cold water in a glass. Gradually add 5 level scoops (enclosed) or 45.4gm of powder while stirring and mix until dissolved. When mixed as directed powder provides approx. 1 kcal per ml. A 400gm Can powder yields approx. nine 225ml servings.

Post-menopausal osteoporosis- 10mg once daily. To permit adequate absorption, alendronate Tablet must be taken in an empty stomach with a full glass of water, at least 30 minutes before the breakfast or first food or drink or medication of the day. Patients should stand or sit upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the alendronate Tablet & do not lie down until after earting breakfast. Patients should not chew or suck on the Tablet & don’t take the Tablet ant bed time.

doseList.description: Children- Not recommended.

doseList.indication: in Patients with mild to moderate hypercalcaemia (albumin- corrected serum calcium<3mmol/1 or <12 mg/dl)
doseList.description: in general patients with osteolytic bone metastases require lower doses than patients with the humoral type of hypercalcaemia. In Patients with mild to moderate hypercalcaemia (albumin- corrected serum calcium<3mmol/1 or <12 mg/dl) 2 mg is an effective dose. In most patients with severe hypercalcaemia (albumin-corrected serum calcium> 3mmol/1 or > 12mg/dl) 4 mg will be an adequate dosage. The highest dose used in clinical trials was 6mg but this dose dose not adds any further benefit in terms of efficacy. Adult & elderly: Prior to treatment with ibandronic acid the patient should be adequately rehydrated with 0.9% sodium Childride, Consideration should be given to the severity of the hypercalcaemia as well as the tumour type.

doseList.description: Adult: The recommended daily dose is 5 mg (1 Tablet) orally. The absorption of risedronate is affected by foods and drinks, so, this should not be taken with food or drinks other than water. Take the dose (1 Tablet) once daily, either at least 30 minutes before the first food or drink (other than water of the day). Or at least 2 hours from any food or drink at any other time of the day, and at least 30 minutes before going to bed. Supplemental calcium and vitamin D should be considered if the dietary in take is inadequate. In all cases including duration of treatment physician’s prescription and advice must be strictly followed.

The patients responding to initial (3 cycle) therapy should continue capecitabine till they maintain tumour response or stable disease.

Antidote to methotrexate (Folinic acid rescue): in general, folinic acid shold not be administered simultancously wih systemic methotrexate because the therapeutic effect of te antimetabolite may be nullified. However, when methotrexate is administered by intrathecal Injection, folinic acid may be given I.M, I.or orally Concomitantly to offset systemic methotrexate without abolishing the local activity of the antineoplastic drug. As part of a high-dose methotrexate regimen in cancer chemotherapy, folinic acid rescue therapy should beging 8-24 hours after the beginning of mehotrexate administration. Generally, doses up to 120mg have heen given over 12-24 hours by I.M, or I.V Injection or I.V. Infusion, followed by 12-15mg I.M or 15mg orally, every 6 hours for the next 48 hours. With lower doses of methotrexate, 15mg folinic acid orall every hour for 48-72 hours may e sufficient.

subDoseList.condition: by I.M, or I.V Injection or I.Infusion
subDoseList.notes: As part of a high-dose methotrexate regimen in cancer chemotherapy, folinic acid rescue therapy should beging 8-24 hours after the beginning of mehotrexate administration.

doseList.indication: Treatment of overdose of folic acid antagonists
doseList.description: Treatment of overdose of folic acid antagonists: In cases of overdosage of folic acid antagonist, folinic acid may be administered by I.Infusion in doses up to 75mg within 12 hours, followed by 12 mg I.M every 6 hours for 4 doses. In general, where overdosage is suspected, the dose of folinic acid should e equal to or higher than the offending dose of the folic acid antagonist administered, and should be given as soon as possible; preferably within the first hour, after wich it is much less effective.

The recommended dose of bevacizumab is 5mg/kg of body weight given once every 14 days asan I.Infusion. Bevacizumab should be prepared by a healthcare professional using aseptic technique. Withdraw the volume of bevacizumab equivalent to a dose of 5mg/kg hody weight and dilute in a total volume of 100ml of sterile, pyrogen-free 0.9% sodium chloride. No incompatibilities between bevacizumab and polyvinyl chloride or polyolefin bags have been observed (error! Reference source not found). Bevacizumab Infusions should not be administered or mixed with dextrose or glucose solutions (error! Reference source not found). Do not administer as an intravenous push or bolus. The initial bevacizumab dose should be delivered over 90 minutes as an I.Infusion. If the first Infusion is well tolerated, the second Infusion may be administered over 60 minutes. If the 60-minute Infusion is well tolerated, all subsequent Infusions may be administered over 30minutes. doseList.description: The recommended dosage of imatinib is 400mg/day for paticnts in chronic phase CML and 600mg/day for patients in accelerated phase or blast crisis. The recommended dosage of imatinib is 400mg/day or 600mg/day for patients with unresectable and metastatic, malignant GIST. In CML, dose increase from 400mg to 600mg in patients with chronic phase disease, or from 600mg to 800mg (given as 400mg twice daily) in paients in accelerated phase or blast crisis may be considered n the absence of severe drug reaction and severe non-leukemia related neutropenia or thrombocytopenia in the following circumstances: disease progression (at any time); failure to achive a satisfactory hematologic response after at least 3 months of treatmet loss of previously achieved hematologic response.

doseList.indication: for paticent with carcinoma of the overy
doseList.secondaryIndication: 1.  For previously untreated patients with carcinoma of the overy
doseList.description: All patients should be premedicated prior to paclitaxel administration in order to prevent severe hypersensitivity reactions. Such premedication may consist of dexamethasone 20mg administered orally approximately 12 nad 6 hours before paclitaxel, diphenhydramine (or its equivalent) 50mg I.V 30 to 60 minutes prior to paclitaxel, and cimetidine (300mg) or ranitidine (50mg) I.V 30 to 60 minutes before paclitaxel. Treatment regimen:for paticent with carcinoma of the overy, the following regimens  are recommended. 1.  For previously untreated patients with carcinoma of the overy, one of the following recommended regiments may be given every 3 weeks. In sclecting the appropriate regimen, differences in toxicities should be considered. a.  Paclitaxel administered I.over 3 hours at a dose of 175mg followed by cisplatin at a dose of 75mg. Or, b.  Paclitaxel administered I.over 24 hours at a dose of 135mg followed by cisplation at a dose of 75mg.

Treatment regimen:for paticent with carcinoma of the overy, the following regimens  are recommended. 2. After failure of initial chemotherapy for metastatic diseaseor relapse within 6 months of adjuvant chemotherapy, paclitaxel at a dose of 175mg administered intravenously over 3 hours every 3 weeks has been shown to be effective.

All patients should be premedicated prior to paclitaxel administration in order to prevent severe hypersensitivity reactions. Such premedication may consist of dexamethasone 20mg administered orally approximately 12 nad 6 hours before paclitaxel, diphenhydramine (or its equivalent) 50mg I.V 30 to 60 minutes prior to paclitaxel, and cimetidine (300mg) or ranitidine (50mg) I.V 30 to 60 minutes before paclitaxel. Patients with AIDS-related Kaposi’s sarcoma: Paclitaxel administered at a dose of 135mg given intravenously over 3 hours every 3 weeks or ata dose of 100mg given intravenously over 3 hours every 2 weeks is recommended (dose intensity 45-50mg/week). In the two clinical trials evaluationg these schedules, the former schedule (135mg every 3 weeks)was more toxic than the latter. In addition, all patients with low performance status were treated with the latter schedule (100mg every 2 weeks).

doseList.description: a single dose of Avaxim 160 units (0.5ml dose) is used for primary immunization. A booster dose is recommended at any time between 6 and 12 months after the primary immunization, in order to ensure long term protection. Avaxim is administered by I.M Injection. The site of Injection is the deltoid region in Adults and older Children, and antero-lateral port of the thigh in young Children. The vaccine should not be administered in the gluteal region. The vaccine should not be administered subcutaneously or intradermally since adminisration by these routes may result in a less than optimal anti-HAV antibody response. Avaxim should under on circumstances be administered intravenously.

doseList.description: Fentanyl may also be given as an Infusion. In ventilated patients, a loading dose of fentanyl may be given as a fast Infusionof approximately 1mcg/kg/min for the first 10 minutes followed by an Infusion of approximately 0.1mcg/kg/minimum alternatively the loading dose of fentanyl may be given as a bolus. Infusion rates should be titrated to individual patient pesponse; lower Infusion rates may be adequate. Unless it is planned to ventilate post-operatively, the Infusion should be terminated at about 40 minutes before the end of surgery. Lower Infusion rates, e.g 0.05-0.08 mcg/kg/minimum are necessary if spontaneous ventilation is to be maintained. Higher Infusion rates (up to 3mcg/kg/min) have been used in cardiac surgery.

In neonates, lower thanthe Children doses, i.e. 50-60 mcg/kg are suggested. These doses produce relaxation for surgical intervantions of 25-35 min duration. IF necessary, muscle relaxation can be prolonged for further 25-35 min by the supplemental administration of the one third of the initial dose. Residual relaxation can be reversed rapidly and safely by the administration of neostigmine and atropine. Due to the great variety of individual response, monitoring of drug effect by a peripheral nerve stimulitor  is highly recommended.

The doses recommende below should be regarded as a guide for use in the average Adult. Spinal anaesthesia for sugery- 2-4ml (10-20mg). The spread of anaesthesia obtained with Ultracaine Heavy depends on several factors including the volume of solution and te position of the patient during and following the Injection. When injected in the L3-L4intervertebral space with the patient in the sitting position, 3ml of Ultracaine Heavy spreads of to the T7-T10 spinal segments. With the patient receiving the Injection in the horizontal position and then turned supine, the blockade spreads to T4-T7 spinal segments, it should be understood that the level of spinal anaesthesia achieved with any local anaesthetic can be unpredictable in a given patient. The effects of Utracaine Heavy exceeding 5ml have not yet been studied and such volumes can therefore not be recommended.

doseList.description: The usual recommended dose for prophylaxis and treatment is two sprays (50mcg/spray) in each nostril once daily (total dose 200mcg). Once symptoms are controlled, dose reduction to  one spray in each nostril (total dose 100mcg) may be effective for matintenance.If symptoms are inadequately controlled, the dose may be increased to a maximum daily dose of four sprays in each nostril once daily (total dose 400mcg). Dose reduction is recommednded following control of symptoms.Clinically significant onset of action occurs as early as 12 hours after the first dose.
